author: Special Correspondent
text:
The consumer movement should be strengthened in the country to put an end to corruption and malpractices, said T. S. Krishnamurthy, former Chief Election Commissioner.

Poverty could not be eradicated in the country even after 68 years of Independence due to lack of awareness among the public.

The Government should take effective steps to strengthen the consumer movement, which in turn will enable in creating awareness among the people, Mr. Krishnamurthy said while speaking the World Consumer Day celebrations brought up by the Salem Consumer Voice here on Sunday.

Officials have to play a pro-active role to keep an eye on the functioning of the elected representatives. They should not hesitate to point out the mistakes of the people in power and correct them whenever needed.

The consumer power should increase for the overall development of any country. Consumers should understand their rights and establish the same whenever possible.

Corruption is hampering the progress of the country. Countries such as Sweden and Norway have achieved great progress due to the absence of corruption. India can become a super power and can compete with world countries only if corruption is shown the exit. The people support is vital for the elimination of corruption from public life, he said and stressed the need for creating awareness in this regard.

M. Tirumalakumar, Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, demanded the consumer movements to create awareness on Right to Education Act among the common people. J. M. Boopathi, president, Salem Consumer Voice, presided.
title: ‘Strengthen consumer movement to end corruption’
